# 1 Installation
***
</br>

```{r,eval=FALSE}
install.packages("shiny")
library(shiny)
```

</br>
</br>

# 2 To Start with
*** 

</br>

Shiny apps have two basic components:

* a user-interface script (ui.R)

* a server script (server.R)

</br>

## 2.1 Create an app
***

### Step 1: Store ui.R and server.R in the same folder.

```{r,echo=FALSE}
fluidPage(
  tabsetPanel(
    tabPanel('server.R',
             code('library(shiny)
shinyServer(function(input, output) {
  output$plot=renderPlot({
    hist(faithful$eruptions, probability = TRUE, breaks = as.numeric(input$n_breaks),
         xlab = "Duration (minutes)", main = "Geyser eruption duration")
    
    dens <- density(faithful$eruptions, adjust = input$bw_adjust)
    lines(dens, col = "blue")
  })
})')),
    tabPanel('ui.R',
             code('shinyUI(
fluidPage(
  sidebarPanel(
    selectInput("n_breaks", label = "Number of bins:",
                choices = c(10, 20, 35, 50), selected = 20),
    
    sliderInput("bw_adjust", label = "Bandwidth adjustment:",
                min = 0.2, max = 2, value = 1, step = 0.2)
  ),
  mainPanel(
    plotOutput("plot")
  )
))'))
  )
)




```
</br>
</br>

### Step 2:
  
__Option 1__
```{r,eval=FALSE}
runApp(getwd()) # the working directory where you stored the two files
```


__Option 2__
    
Press the 'run App' bottom

### Step 3: Publish
  

__Option 1__
    
Create an accoount in [website](http://shiny.rstudio.com/). Get the name, token and secret information. Then deploy the App
```{r,eval=FALSE}
library(rsconnect)
rsconnect::setAccountInfo(name='abc',
                          token='def',
                          secret='ghi')
deployApp(account='dss')
```


__Option 2__
    


Press the `publish` bottom and a window would pop up. Follow the instruction and deploy the app.

##2.3 A Simple Example
***

```{r,echo=FALSE}
# ui.R
inputPanel(
  selectInput("n_breaks", label = "Number of bins:",
              choices = c(10, 20, 35, 50), selected = 20),
  
  sliderInput("bw_adjust", label = "Bandwidth adjustment:",
              min = 0.2, max = 2, value = 1, step = 0.2)
)

#server.R
renderPlot({
  hist(faithful$eruptions, probability = TRUE, breaks = as.numeric(input$n_breaks),
       xlab = "Duration (minutes)", main = "Geyser eruption duration")
  
  dens <- density(faithful$eruptions, adjust = input$bw_adjust)
  lines(dens, col = "blue")
})

```
</br>
</br>

##2.4 Detailed Codes
***

```{r,eval=FALSE}
# ui.R
shinyUI(
fluidPage(
  sidebarPanel(
    selectInput("n_breaks", label = "Number of bins:",
                choices = c(10, 20, 35, 50), selected = 20),
    
    sliderInput("bw_adjust", label = "Bandwidth adjustment:",
                min = 0.2, max = 2, value = 1, step = 0.2)
  ),
  mainPanel(
    plotOutput('plot')
  )
))
  
#server.R
library(shiny)
shinyServer(function(input, output) {
  output$plot=renderPlot({
    hist(faithful$eruptions, probability = TRUE, breaks = as.numeric(input$n_breaks),
         xlab = "Duration (minutes)", main = "Geyser eruption duration")
    
    dens <- density(faithful$eruptions, adjust = input$bw_adjust)
    lines(dens, col = "blue")
  })
})

```
</br>
</br>


## 2.5 Conditional Panel and Error Message
***

```{r,echo=FALSE}
fluidPage(
  sidebarPanel(
     radioButtons("chooseAction", strong("Choose action:"),
                 choices = c("select" = "select",
                             "input"="input"),inline=F),
conditionalPanel( condition= "input.chooseAction == 'input'",   
  numericInput("n_breaks2", label = h3("Number of bins:"), value = 10)),
conditionalPanel( condition= "input.chooseAction == 'select'",   
  selectInput("n_breaks3", label = "Number of bins:",
                choices = c(10, 20, 35, 50), selected = 20)),

  sliderInput("bw_adjust2", label = "Bandwidth adjustment:",
              min = 0.2, max = 2, value = 1, step = 0.2)
  ),
  mainPanel(
    conditionalPanel(condition='input.n_breaks2<40',
   plotOutput('hist')),
   conditionalPanel(condition='input.n_breaks2>40',
    br(),
    textOutput('Error')
                 
                    )
  )
)


output$hist=renderPlot({
  
  if (input$chooseAction == 'input'){n_breaks=as.numeric(input$n_breaks2)} 
  else{n_breaks=as.numeric(input$n_breaks3)} 
  if(n_breaks>40) {return(NULL)}
  hist(faithful$eruptions, probability = TRUE, breaks = n_breaks,
       xlab = "Duration (minutes)", main = "Geyser eruption duration")
  
  dens <- density(faithful$eruptions, adjust = input$bw_adjust2)
  lines(dens, col = "blue")})

output$Error=renderText(print('Error Message'))
```

##3.2  Widgets
***

To add a widget to your app, place a widget function in sidebarPanel or mainPanel in your ui.R file.

Each widget function requires several arguments. The first two arguments for each widget are

* A __Name for the widget__. The user will not see this name, but you can use it to access the widgetâ€™s value. The name should be a character string.

* A __label__. This label will appear with the widget in your app. It should be a character string, but it can be an empty string "".
</br>
</br>

```{r,echo=FALSE}
fluidPage(
  tabsetPanel(
    tabPanel('server.R',
             code('library(shiny)
shinyServer(function(input, output) {
  output$plot=renderPlot({
    hist(faithful$eruptions, probability = TRUE, breaks = as.numeric(input$n_breaks),
         xlab = "Duration (minutes)", main = "Geyser eruption duration")
    
    dens <- density(faithful$eruptions, adjust = input$bw_adjust)
    lines(dens, col = "blue")
  })
})')),
    tabPanel('ui.R',
             code('shinyUI(
fluidPage(
  sidebarPanel(
    selectInput("n_breaks", label = "Number of bins:",
                choices = c(10, 20, 35, 50), selected = 20),
    
    sliderInput("bw_adjust", label = "Bandwidth adjustment:",
                min = 0.2, max = 2, value = 1, step = 0.2)
  ),
  mainPanel(
    plotOutput("plot")
  )
))'))
  )
)

```

##3.3 Display reactive output
***

```{r,message=FALSE}
library(googleVis)
library(shiny)
load('EQI_state.RData')

myType <- reactive({
    input$Type
  })
  output$gvis <- renderGvis({
    myData=EQI_state
    gvisGeoChart(myData,
                 locationvar="state", colorvar=as.character(myType()),
                 options=list(region="US", displayMode="regions", 
                              resolution="provinces",
                              width=500, height=400,
                              colorAxis="{colors:['#FFFFFF', '#0000FF']}"
                 ))     
  })

shinyUI(pageWithSidebar(
  headerPanel("EQI"),
  sidebarPanel(
    selectInput("Type", label = "Types",
                choices = c('Air','Water','Land','Sociod','Built','EQI'), selected = 'EQI')
  ),
  mainPanel(
    h3(textOutput("year")), 
    htmlOutput("gvis")
  )
)
)
```
</br>
</br>





##3.4 Plots
***
  
#### Also works well with __ggplot__ ,  __plot_ly__,  and __GoogleVis__
  
```{r}
# ui
pageWithSidebar(
  headerPanel('Iris k-means clustering'),
  sidebarPanel(
    selectInput('xcol', 'X Variable', names(iris)),
    selectInput('ycol', 'Y Variable', names(iris),
                selected=names(iris)[[2]]),
    numericInput('clusters', 'Cluster count', 3,
                 min = 1, max = 9)
  ),
  mainPanel(
    plotOutput('plot1')
  )
)

#server
  # Combine the selected variables into a new data frame
  selectedData <- reactive({
    iris[, c(input$xcol, input$ycol)]
  })

  clusters <- reactive({
    kmeans(selectedData(), input$clusters)
  })

  output$plot1 <- renderPlot({
    palette(c("#E41A1C", "#377EB8", "#4DAF4A", "#984EA3",
      "#FF7F00", "#FFFF33", "#A65628", "#F781BF", "#999999"))

    par(mar = c(5.1, 4.1, 0, 1))
    plot(selectedData(),
         col = clusters()$cluster,
         pch = 20, cex = 3)
    points(clusters()$centers, pch = 4, cex = 4, lwd = 4)
  })


```

## 4.1 Installation
```{r,eval=FALSE,message=FALSE}
install.packages("shinydashboard")
library(shinydashboard)
```

</br>

##4.2  Overview
***

You can quickly view it at the R console by using the ```shinyApp()``` function

```{r,message=FALSE}
library(shiny)
library(shinydashboard)

ui <- dashboardPage(
  dashboardHeader(),
  dashboardSidebar(),
  dashboardBody()
)

server <- function(input, output) { }

shinyApp(ui, server)
```

</br>
</br>

##4.3 Detailed Codes
***



```{r,echo=FALSE}
fluidPage(
  tabsetPanel(
    tabPanel('server.R',
             code('shinyServer(
function(input, output) {
  set.seed(122)
  histdata <- rnorm(500)
  
  output$plot1 <- renderPlot({
    data <- histdata[seq_len(input$slider)]
    hist(data)
  })
})')),
    tabPanel('ui.R',
             code('
library(shinydashboard)
shinyUI(

dashboardPage(
  dashboardHeader(title = "Basic dashboard"),
  dashboardSidebar(),
  dashboardBody(
    # Boxes need to be put in a row (or column)
    fluidRow(
      box(plotOutput("plot1", height = 250)),
      
      box(
        title = "Controls",
        sliderInput("slider", "Number of observations:", 1, 100, 50)
      )
    )
  )
))
                                    '))
  )
)

```

</br>
</br>

Store ui.R and server.R in the same folder named 'example1' in the working directory.


```{r,eval=FALSE}
runApp('example1')
```

```{r,eval=FALSE}
      box(width = 4, actionButton("count", "Increment progress"))
    )


### server
output$progressBox <- renderInfoBox({
    infoBox(
      "Progress", paste0(25 + input$count, "%"), icon = icon("list"),
      color = "purple"
    )
  })
  output$approvalBox <- renderInfoBox({
    infoBox(
      "Approval", "80%", icon = icon("thumbs-up", lib = "glyphicon"),
      color = "yellow"
    )
  })

  # Same as above, but with fill=TRUE
  output$progressBox2 <- renderInfoBox({
    infoBox(
      "Progress", paste0(25 + input$count, "%"), icon = icon("list"),
      color = "purple", fill = TRUE
    )
  })
  output$approvalBox2 <- renderInfoBox({
    infoBox(
      "Approval", "80%", icon = icon("thumbs-up", lib = "glyphicon"),
      color = "yellow", fill = TRUE
    )
  })
```

##5.1 leaflet Package

#### Compose maps using arbitrary combinations of:

*  Map tiles
    *  Default (OpenStreetMap)
    *  Third_party 
*  Markers
*  Polygons
*  Lines
*  Popups

#### Simple example
```{r,message=FALSE}
library(leaflet)

m <- leaflet() %>%
  addTiles() %>%  # Add default OpenStreetMap map tiles
  addMarkers(lng=-73.962761, lat=40.809061, popup="Introduction to Data Science")
m
```

##5.2 Display Data table
***
```{r,echo=FALSE}
# ui
library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)  # for the diamonds dataset

fluidPage(
  title = 'Examples of DataTables',
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      conditionalPanel(
        'input.dataset === "diamonds"',
        checkboxGroupInput('show_vars', 'Columns in diamonds to show:',
                           names(diamonds), selected = names(diamonds))
      ),
      conditionalPanel(
        'input.dataset === "mtcars"',
        helpText('Click the column header to sort a column.')
      ),
      conditionalPanel(
        'input.dataset === "iris"',
        helpText('Display 5 records by default.')
      )
    ),
    mainPanel(
      tabsetPanel(
        id = 'dataset',
        tabPanel('diamonds', DT::dataTableOutput('mytable1')),
        tabPanel('mtcars', DT::dataTableOutput('mytable2')),
        tabPanel('iris', DT::dataTableOutput('mytable3'))
      )
    )
  )
)

# server



  # choose columns to display
  diamonds2 = diamonds[sample(nrow(diamonds), 1000), ]
  output$mytable1 <- DT::renderDataTable({
    DT::datatable(diamonds2[, input$show_vars, drop = FALSE])
  })

  # sorted columns are colored now because CSS are attached to them
  output$mytable2 <- DT::renderDataTable({
    DT::datatable(mtcars, options = list(orderClasses = TRUE))
  })

  # customize the length drop-down menu; display 5 rows per page by default
  output$mytable3 <- DT::renderDataTable({
    DT::datatable(iris, options = list(lengthMenu = c(5, 30, 50), pageLength = 5))
  })


```
